text: during the late 1970s David Berkowitz
known as the Son of Sam went on a
notorious crime spree and killed six
people in wounded seven in New York City
described as a deeply disturbed loner
Berkowitz was sent to prison for six
consecutive life sentences but in the
years since Berkowitz has attracted a
network of friends and acquaintances
outside of prison that has raised a
number of eyebrows there are different
friends from all walks of life all of
them are Christians they use my
testimony to reach other people and it's
been encouraging to a lot of people so I
think I'm thankful for that like Dan
Nichols a retired school teacher who
says that he and Berkowitz are best
friends or Roxanne toriello who does
ministry work with Berkowitz that sends
free Bibles to Africa Berkowitz became a
born-again Christian more than two
decades ago and in an unusual public
relations makeover he has transformed
himself from the Son of Sam into the son
of hope well it definitely gives me
meaning and purpose as a Christian to
serve God bring other people messages of
encouragement and hope inspiration I'm
thankful to be able to reach other
people in a good way you know a good
positive encouraging wait evangelical
Christians helped him run a site called
a rise in shine the site promotes his
prison journals ministry tools and
contains apology for his crimes in
several different languages but he says
the site has one main purpose to glorify
God to let people know that there's hope
that there's forgiveness that God is a
God of second chances it's basically
about the mercy compassion of God I know
from the responses that it's out there
and it's doing a good job so to speak
Berkowitz has never actually seen the
website he does not have computer access
he is allowed to receive visitors and
phone calls but he mostly stays in touch
by sending about two dozen typewritten
letters a week to various people and
organizations but some connected with
the Son of Sam case expressed deep
skepticism the Berkowitz is really a
changed man
but Berkowitz believes these
relationships have helped him deal with
life behind bars Prison is very
difficult all these years ago body
separated from his family you know you
realize the effects of your own
decisions and your bad choices I'm so
grateful for the friendship and the
fellowship
